nodes.bodyText:
Use of maven release plugin to drop snapshot, tag and bump a version is a popular way to do this.
Alternatively, we may have parent pom to manage single version across modules.

you can't have a single version in the parent AND use the version for submodules to find the parent.
[ERROR] [ERROR] Some problems were encountered while processing the POMs:
[FATAL] 'parent.version' is missing. @ line 22, column 10
[FATAL] 'parent.version' is missing. @ line 18, column 10
I think we can just bump the version whenever a new release is cut .  actually, when the maint branch is cut it can be manually updated.
It's managed by Eclipse. This is automatically generated file, so I think we don't need to worry about version much.

Looks good to me.
One comment - do we want to use "java" as component folder name? I prefer to use folder name matching artifact ID.

Yes, I'd like to rename it, maybe cldr-utils? Not sure.
How is this triggered and how does it relate to other ways of deployment?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -51,4 +64,50 @@ jobs:
           '-Dorg.unicode.cldr.unittest.web.KeepDb=true'
         env:
           GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
-
+  check:
+    needs: build
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    steps:
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+        with:
+          lfs: false
+      - name: Set up JDK 1.8
+        uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+        with:
+          java-version: 1.8
+      - name: Download cldr.jar
+        uses: actions/download-artifact@v2
+        with:
+          name: cldr-tools
+          path: tools/java/target/
+      - name: run CLDR console check
+        run: java -DCLDR_DIR=$(pwd) -jar tools/java/target/cldr.jar check -S common,seed -e -z FINAL_TESTING 
+  deploy:
+    if: github.repository == 'unicode-org/cldr' && github.event_name == 'push' && github.ref == 'refs/heads/master'
+    needs:
+      - build
+      - check
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    steps:
+    - name: Download cldr-apps.war
+      uses: actions/download-artifact@v2
+      with:
+        name: cldr-apps
+    - name: Deploy to cldr-smoke (experimental)

nodes.bodyText: This is the deploy to smoketest on merge that currently is done with ant.  It's triggered the same way.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -51,4 +64,50 @@ jobs:
           '-Dorg.unicode.cldr.unittest.web.KeepDb=true'
         env:
           GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
-
+  check:
+    needs: build
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    steps:
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+        with:
+          lfs: false
+      - name: Set up JDK 1.8
+        uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+        with:
+          java-version: 1.8
+      - name: Download cldr.jar
+        uses: actions/download-artifact@v2
+        with:
+          name: cldr-tools
+          path: tools/java/target/
+      - name: run CLDR console check
+        run: java -DCLDR_DIR=$(pwd) -jar tools/java/target/cldr.jar check -S common,seed -e -z FINAL_TESTING 
+  deploy:
+    if: github.repository == 'unicode-org/cldr' && github.event_name == 'push' && github.ref == 'refs/heads/master'
+    needs:
+      - build
+      - check
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    steps:
+    - name: Download cldr-apps.war
+      uses: actions/download-artifact@v2
+      with:
+        name: cldr-apps
+    - name: Deploy to cldr-smoke (experimental)

nodes.bodyText: Eclipse insert extra blank lines when a configuration file is updated. This is probably a bug in Eclipse. You may get rid of these unnecessary blank lines inserted automatically.
yeah. I was going to ignore these files originally, but I think we should just let them get updated…
